intro: Asplundia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered asplundia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of leaves. The plant produces small, pale green or white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant.
